document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Casey, T. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Casey, T. L. (1905) A revision of the American Paederini. Transactions of the Academy of Science of St. Louis, 15 (2), 17 - 248.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.

bibRefCitation.author: Casey, T. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Casey, T. L. (1905) A revision of the American Paederini. Transactions of the Academy of Science of St. Louis, 15 (2), 17 - 248.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Cryptobium prospiciens LeConte in Schwarz, 1878
21 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Key: Blackwelder 1943: 336 (species of the West Indies).
West Indies: Cuba , Jamaica , Haiti , Dominican Republic , Puerto Rico , Antigua & Barbuda , Montserrat , Guadeloupe , Grenada , Trinidad-Tobago.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Ecuador , Brazil , Argentina .

bibRefCitation.author: Hochhuth, J. H.
bibRefCitation.refString: Hochhuth, J. H. (1851) Beitraege aur naeheren Kenntniss der Staphylinen Russlands. Enthaltend Beschreibung neuer Genera und Arten, nebst Erlauterungen noch nicht hinlanglich bekannter Staphylinen des russischen Reichs. Bulletin de la Societe Imperiale des Naturalistes de Moscou, 24 (2), 3 - 58.

bibRefCitation.author: Casey, T. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Casey, T. L. (1886 a) Revision of the California species of Lithocharis and allied genera. Bulletin of the California Academy of Sciences, 2 (5), 1 - 40.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Cryptobium tumidum LeConte in Schwarz, 1878

bibRefCitation.author: Hochhuth, J. H.
bibRefCitation.refString: Hochhuth, J. H. (1851) Beitraege aur naeheren Kenntniss der Staphylinen Russlands. bibRefCitation.author: Blackwelder, R. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Blackwelder, R. E. (1939) A generic revision of the staphylinid beetles of the tribe Paederini. Proceedings of the United States National Museum, 87, 93 - 125. https: // doi. org / 10.5479 / si. 00963801.87 - 3069.93

subSubSection.paragraph: 67 species are included in this genus from Latin America.

Characters/Description: Casey 1905: 24 (characters in key as
Homaeotarsus
and
Eucryptina
), 28 (characters as
Homaeotarsus
and
Eucryptina
); Blackwelder 1939: 95 (characters in key); Blackwelder 1943: 230 (characters in key), 325 (characters);
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002: 266
(characters in key); Newton & Peck 2006: 148 (characters in key).
Key: Blackwelder 1939: 96 (subgenera); Blackwelder 1943: 326 (species of the West Indies).
West Indies: Cuba , Cayman Is., Jamaica , Haiti , Dominican Republic , Puerto Rico , St. Vincent & Grenadines , Grenada , Trinidad-Tobago.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , El Salvador , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Galapagos Isl., Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Madagascan, Oriental .

bibRefCitation.author: Blackwelder, R. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Blackwelder, R. E. (1939) A generic revision of the staphylinid beetles of the tribe Paederini. Proceedings of the United States National Museum, 87, 93 - 125. https: // doi. org / 10.5479 / si. 00963801.87 - 3069.93

bibRefCitation.author: Stephens, J. F.
bibRefCitation.refString: Stephens, J. F. (1829 a) The nomenclature of British insects: Being a compendious list of such species as are contained in the systematic catalogue of British insects and forming a guide to their classification, & c. & c. Baldwin and Cradock, London. 68 pp. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. title. 51800

subSubSection.paragraph: 113 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
Key: Lynch-Arribálzaga 1884: 205 (species of Buenos Aires province , Argentina ); Blackwelder 1943: 332 (species of the West Indies).
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , French Guiana , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Uruguay , Chile , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.

bibRefCitation.author: Blackwelder, R. E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Blackwelder, R. E. (1952) The generic names of the beetle family Staphylinidae, with an essay on genotypy. Bulletin of the United States National Museum, 200, iv + 483 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph: 8 species are known from and are restricted to Latin America.
13 species are known from and are restricted to Central and South America.

bibRefCitation.author: Sharp, D. S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Sharp, D. S. (1876 a) Contribution to an insect fauna of the Amazon Valley. Coleoptera-Staphylinidae. Transactions of the Entomological Society of London, 24 (1 - 2), 27 - 424. https: // doi. org / 10.1111 / j. 1365 - 2311.1876. tb 01123. x

subSubSection.paragraph: 2 species are known from and are restricted to South America.
Characters/Description: Casey 1905: 55 (characters in key); Blackwelder 1939: 95 (characters in key). Distribution.
